page.title: 08Mendip Village Churches
page.content: { Batcombe church}is large. Today the church worship reflects the three strata that make up the village.{ {Farming,}reinforced by an increasing number of{retired people}has lead to a traditional form of worship. The third strand is{artisan}and{commuters}with young families and these have enabled the church to include{fresh ways of {worship.}Thus the church tries to help its people to make sense of their lives and offer God thanks in a way that is meaningful and yet wide enough to span their experience. {Upton Noble church}is small. Again very traditional with services in the 'old language' but a strong element, provided by young families, worship using the newest form of 'simplified language'. No polarity is caused by the different ways of worship but a desire to find a richer unity.
